title: Lewis & Clark National Historic Trail: Environmental Factors
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     Nature     Environmental Factors               Environmental Factors         Looking west from Montana Rt. 275 between Three Forks and Helena, near Townsend, Montana. NPS JH-Anderson  Many environmental factors exist along the Lewis and Clark National Historic Trail. Everything from non-native species to untimely releases of water from dams, to the loss of habitats, can have significant impacts to this historic corridor.     Learn about some of these factors by visiting sites along the trail highlighted in the right-hand column.
